revised_title: Description and Discovery of a New Bird Species: Motacilla arundinacea
tldr: The author, John Lightfoot, describes the discovery and characteristics of a previously unknown bird species in the Motacilla genus, which he names Motacilla arundinacea. The bird is found near rivers and has a unique nest structure made of dry grass and reed flowers. It is similar in size to the Willow-wren and feeds on insects.
